description:
**Fix Overview**:

To mitigate the Microsoft Windows performance data helper library remote code execution vulnerability (CVE-2024-38028), multiple updates must be applied based on your Windows version:

1. Download and install the appropriate updates from the Microsoft Update Catalog:
   - For Windows 11 Version 23H2: [KB5040442](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040442)
   - For Windows 11 Version 22H2: [KB5040442](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040442)
   - For Windows 11 Version 21H2: [KB5040431](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040431)
   - For Windows 10 Version 22H2 for x64-based Systems: [KB5040427](https://catalog.update.microsoft.com/Search.aspx?q=KB5040427)
   - Additional updates may be required for other configurations; please refer to the Microsoft Update Catalog links provided.

2. Restart your system after installation to ensure the changes take effect.

**Details**:
This vulnerability can lead to remote code execution, which may allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code on the affected system if the user opens a specially crafted file. To protect your system, it's crucial to apply these updates promptly.

**Preconditions**:
- Ensure the system corresponds to the listed versions before proceeding with the update installation.
- Backup critical data as a precaution before applying updates.
